SCP 0.6.0

SCP-SeuratV5 Development Guide

Source: CLAUDE.md

Build/Test/Lint Commands

  • Build: devtools::build() or R CMD build .
  • Documentation: devtools::document()
  • Check: devtools::check() or R CMD check --no-manual .
  • Test: devtools::test() or testthat::test_package("SCP")
  • Test single file: testthat::test_file("tests/testthat/test-file.R")
  • Lint: styler::style_pkg()
  • Build docs site: pkgdown::build_site()

Python Environment Setup

# Option 1: Set option before loading the package
options(SCP_env_init = TRUE)
library(SCP)

# Option 2: Initialize after loading the package
library(SCP)
PrepareEnv() # Only needed once to create the environment

# Option 3: Manually setup with reticulate
library(reticulate)
use_condaenv("SCP_env")
options(SCP_env_init = TRUE) # This must be set before loading SCP
library(SCP)

macOS Apple Silicon Compatibility

When using SCP on macOS, especially on Apple Silicon (M1/M2/M3), you may encounter issues with Python integration. The following helps prevent crashes:

# Set this environment variable before loading SCP to avoid OpenMP conflicts
Sys.setenv(KMP_DUPLICATE_LIB_OK = "TRUE")
library(SCP)

For Apple Silicon users, some Python-dependent functions like scVI_integrate might be unstable and cause segmentation faults. Consider using these alternatives: - Harmony_integrate() (recommended) - Seurat_integrate() - fastMNN_integrate()

Code Style Guidelines

  • Function names: CamelCase with initial capital (e.g., RunPAGA)
  • Helper functions: snake_case (e.g., try_get)
  • Variables: snake_case
  • Parameters: period-separated (e.g., group.by, reduction)
  • Indentation: 2 spaces
  • Documentation: roxygen2 with comprehensive @param, @return, @examples
  • Comments: # with space following
  • Imports: Use @importFrom tags or package::function notation
  • Error handling: Use tryCatch() for robust error handling
  • Line length: Keep under 120 characters
  • Default parameters: Provide sensible defaults when possible
